clinical_study.brief_title: Factors Predicting Success in Lung Transplant Recipients Who Have Undergone Intensive Post-operative Rehabilitation
clinical_study.official_title: Factors Predicting Success in Lung Transplant Recipients Who Have Participated in the COLTT Program (Daily Intensive Post-hospitalization Rehabilitation): A Retrospective Review

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective review of the COLTT program outcomes and factors that predict recovery of functional status after lung transplantation.

detailed_description.textblock: The Center of Life for Thoracic Transplant (COLTT) program is a daily (5 days per week) intensive rehabilitation program for patients who have undergone lung transplant. Patients are enrolled in COLTT as part of standard care after hospital discharge. This study is a retrospective review of seventy patients that measures the efficacy of the COLTT program and establishes predictors of patient success.This study will also measure the effect of functional outcomes on hospital readmission post COLTT discharge.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The number of days in the COLTT program required to reach program goals ( see secondary outcomes measures)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Gait speed (walking speed) is measured daily on a oval track

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The test result of a single leg stance test. Patients stand with hands on their hips, raise one leg off the ground and hold it for as long as possible.

secondary_outcome.measure: One-minute sit to stand performance (number, % expected)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The test result of a one-minute sit to stand test. Patients stand/sit from a chair as many times as they can in one minute.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The test result of a six-minute walk test, a field test of exercise capacity

other_outcome.description: Measured as number of hospital readmissions

intervention.description: 5 days per week, 2.5 hours per day strength, balance and endurance training on an outpatient basis

study_pop.textblock: Lung transplant recipients at IU Health Methodist Hospital. As part of standard care, all patients who survive to hospital discharge are referred by transplant pulmonologists to the COLTT program.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients who completed the COLTT program from May, 2016 to July, 2017.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any COLTT patients who were not new lung transplant recipients.
